pullRequest.body:
In all cases, the original proof works now. I presume this is due to simp changes in Lean 4.7, but haven't verified.

---

Picked from  [another branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/MR-porting-notes-simp) that needs to be cleaned up/split more.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Can you change the language and then merge? Thanks! Great to see things cleaned up. 

bors delegate+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8672558895/job/23782996424)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8672558895/job/23782996250)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8672558895/job/23782996342)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think that if the remaining boundary cases in this diff are amply documented, then this is ready for merging.

(So please follow-up on eg Matt's suggestion to use `supply` instead of `add`.)

Thanks for doing this!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

The corresponding [mathlib3 line](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/blob/65a1391a0106c9204fe45bc73a039f056558cb83/src/measure_theory/constructions/prod/integral.lean#L215) was
`simp only [has_finite_integral, lintegral_prod_of_measurable _ h1f.ennnorm],`
Clarified this porting note; the important part is that these lemmas need to be supplied to simp now. (The former is tagged simp, the latter is not.)
I originally read this as you wrote two new lemmas and tagged them with `simp`. Perhaps "supplied" is a clearer verb.
Also clarified this note: this proof fails without specifying `smul_inv_smul minor` (which is tagged simp).
Supplied here also
I didn't look into whether there is or was a confluence issue: in any case, the original proof works now.

`mem_aux` is a private lemma right before this one which is tagged with a porting note
"/- Porting note: `simp only [mem_iUnion]` fails in the next definition. This aux lemma is a
workaround. -/"
This reverts the workaround in three places.

Actually, this doesn't quite work: the following fixes the build.
```suggestion
    -- Porting note: had to add `Limit.map__apply` (which was un-tagged simp since "simp can
    -- prove it") is this a confluence issue?
    simp [Limit.map__apply, w]

```suggestion
    -- Porting note(#10745): had to add `Limit.map__apply`
    -- (which was un-tagged simp since "simp can prove it")

```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: resolve some simp-related porting notes

nodes.body:
Can you change the language and then merge? Thanks! Great to see things cleaned up. 

bors delegate+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I think that if the remaining boundary cases in this diff are amply documented, then this is ready for merging.

(So please follow-up on eg Matt's suggestion to use `supply` instead of `add`.)

Thanks for doing this!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
